meanings.definition: Convert (data or information) into digital form.
meanings.sent1: I digitized my old photos by scanning them into my computer.
meanings.sent2: The library digitized their collection of rare books for online access.
meanings.sent3: It was quite a task to digitize all the handwritten notes from the meeting.
meanings.sent4: She digitized her thoughts into a blog post for everyone to read.
meanings.sent5: The company digitized their entire filing system, making it much easier to search for documents.

meanings.definition: Represent (an object or image) by generating a series of numbers that describe its shape or position.
meanings.sent1: The 3D printer digitized the model into a file for printing.
meanings.sent2: The satellite digitized the terrain below into detailed maps.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly said he could digitize his messy room into a neat diagram.
meanings.sent4: Her memory digitized the scene into a vivid mental image.
meanings.sent5: The artist digitized the landscape, capturing every detail in the painting.
